programme.desc: A plot to kill the fuhrer that remained secret until the late 1990s. Operation Foxley planned to murder Hitler during his daily morning walk at the Berghof, his Bavarian residence. programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: The veteran naturalist investigates two shells that have proved to be winners in evolution - the bird's egg shell and the hard shell of the tortoise. The ostrich egg is so strong it is possible for it to take a person's weight without breaking - so how does a chick manage break out of such a fortress? The evolution of the tortoise shell was for a long time a mystery, and this bony box offers a lot more than just protection.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: The evolutionary documentary concludes, as David Attenborough profiles the Siamese fighting fish, so aggressive it will fight its own reflection until it is exhausted. He also looks at the kangaroo - once pitted against humans in the boxing ring - which has a kick so strong it can kill.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Footage of plants and animals that live in jungles, one of the hardest environments to thrive in, including strange fungi and creatures that glow in the dark which have never been captured on film before. The programme also includes recordings of caimans and the jaguars that prey on them, freshwater dolphins that swim through flooded forests, undergrowth-dwelling frogs that have to defend themselves against wasps, and the Indri, the world's largest living lemur, which inhabits the forests of Madagascar.

programme.title: Galapagos
programme.desc: High-definition cameras and aerial photography techniques are used to explore the archipelago, which is rich in wildlife and made famous by Charles Darwin's On the Origin of the Species. This programme focuses on the geological history of the islands through the evidence of volcanic eruptions and examines what makes it unique. Tilda Swinton narrates.

programme.title: Galapagos
programme.desc: Examining the lesser-known parts of the islands and the species that have successfully evolved to suit the environment. The programme discovers how tortoise shells have changed shape, flowers have turned yellow to attract bees, and finches have become warblers. Plus, how flightless cormorants are still hunting underwater. Narrated by Tilda Swinton.

programme.title: Galapagos
programme.desc: An insight into how creatures adapt to the islands' extremes of weather, including iguanas that climb more than 1,000 metres to lay eggs, fish forced to rely on the shade provided by mangroves, and seals that survive on exposed shorelines by taking shelter in lava grottos.

programme.title: Blue Planet II
programme.desc: Creatures that live on coral reefs, including groupers, small predators that scientists believe are as intelligent as chimpanzees. These creatures have a remarkable aptitude for communication to the point where they can interact with other species including octopi and work together to catch prey. Plus, footage of a vast spawning event involving several different species of fish, coral and invertebrates, and time-lapse photography of coral polyps growing and dying, creating a structure visible from space.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.sub-title: Great British Railway Journeys Goes to Ireland

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Chris crosses Australia from south to north following the original ill-fated route of the 2,000 mile-long Adelaide to Darwin railway. After beginning his journey on a luxury modern train, he transfers to one of the line's surviving steam locomotives before hitting the Outback, where he quickly concludes that a 4x4 is a more practical means of travelling. He passes through ghost towns and explores abandoned railway relics before uncovering why most of the southern section of the line eventually had to be abandoned. At Alice Springs he hitches a ride on a freight train headed for Darwin and reaches his final destination after nearly 24 hours in the cramped cab.

However, his recently discovered remains reveal a match to an unidentified person and lead to a shocking revelation for Sandra. Guest starring Ken Farrington, David Calder and Diana Quick, with Amanda Redman and Alun Armstrong.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Sandy's policeman boyfriend calls at the house with important news and Alistair suddenly realises he wants to settle down, but he can't decide what should come first - work or romance. Starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The roguish antiques dealer whisks Charlotte away for a weekend in Wales, but before long they find themselves hunting for a murderer and a rare Celtic cross. Drama, starring Ian McShane and Caroline Langrishe.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The dodgy dealer agrees to help Charlotte's friend Mary Gladden save a nursing home by valuing and selling its antiques - only to find himself in the line of fire as someone makes an attempt on his life. Drama, starring Ian McShane, Dudley Sutton, Caroline Langrishe and Susan Fleetwood.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Lance Powell goes undercover in a gay bar in a successful operation to catch a dealer selling lethal crystal meth, but his personal life takes a knock when partner Mark announces he's leaving the Met. Difficult decisions have to be made about a young tearaway when he's accused of mugging an old man, and a remorseful Terry reconsiders his relationship with Lucy after letting Bradley down yet again.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: A Small Piece of the Pie
programme.desc: Neil Manson returns to Sun Hill to work on the murder of a gay man and Phil Hunter spots a pattern in similar recent crimes. Lance Powell teams up with Laura Bryant to investigate a spate of robberies for which the local vicar turns out to be the chief suspect. Mark leaves his partner distraught when he moves out to find some space, and Cindy urges her reluctant husband to open the results of the paternity test.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: When Justice Isn't Enough - Part One
programme.desc: Part one of three. An anonymous caller alerts Phil Hunter to common threads in recent murders, and the team starts looking for a serial killer on the Sun Hill gay scene. Lance Powell struggles to come to terms with Mark's decision to take time out from their relationship and decides to drown his sorrows, but a visit to the gay bar he recently investigated puts him in grave danger.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: When Justice Isn't Enough - Part Two
programme.desc: Part two of three. The shocked Sun Hill relief pull out all the stops to find the killer of popular colleague Lance Powell. As a tearful Laura Bryant is sent home on compassionate leave, a witness provides a breakthrough, and the trail of evidence leads back to Michael Keenan, the barman at gay club Radar. Amid the emotional turmoil, Phil Hunter accompanies Kate as she registers the birth of their son, and is devastated to learn she's leaving to live with her mother in Cardiff.

programme.title: Bramwell
programme.desc: Period medical drama chronicling the personal and professional consequences of Eleanor Bramwell's determined quest to become the first female surgeon at the East London Hospital. Jemma Redgrave stars.

programme.title: Bramwell
programme.desc: Period medical drama chronicling the personal and professional consequences of Eleanor Bramwell's determined quest to become the first female surgeon at the East London Hospital. Jemma Redgrave stars.

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's The Cinder Path
programme.desc: Drama about one man's journey through love and war in the early part of the century. Charlie MacFell returns from university to the family farm, where his strict father still rules with an iron fist _ a situation that soon changes thanks to a misunderstanding with a foolish farmhand. Lloyd Owen stars, with Catherine Zeta Jones, Tom Bell and Maria Mile.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: Ash Park prepares for a visit from the Prime Minister and his wife in support of George's election campaign, and James begins to learn how to relax in public with Harry.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: On the day of the Prime Minister's visit to Ash Park, Regina is in her element making preparations and George is happy to make a speech to his supporters gathered at the gates. Sarah, knowing that she would not be welcome, awaits Harry at Inverness hospital from his transfer from Sydney. Elizabeth, meanwhile, has to time her return home with military precision.

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Hyacinth is waiting for a new three-piece suite to be delivered and goes to extraordinary lengths to ensure her neighbours see the royal warrant on the delivery van. But, as ever, her family contrives to take the gloss off her moment of glory. Comedy, starring Patricia Routledge.

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Hyacinth decides to take Daddy out for a picnic, but her plans soon backfire. Suburban comedy, starring Patricia Routledge, Clive Swift and Geoffrey Hughes.

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: While Richard contends with the idea of taking early retirement, Hyacinth telephones the prime minister asking if there is anything on the honours list for him. The hen-pecked husband's reservations about the future intensify when he discovers all the plans his spouse has in store for him. Comedy, starring Clive Swift and Patricia Routledge.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: Kris Marshall is back as the British detective working on the Caribbean island of Saint Marie, where the sun shines all day and it seems half the residents are killers-in-waiting. And so it appears with the first case when a plantation owner ends up dead during a seance - although with the door firmly closed at the time and all the participants holding hands round the table, who did the deed? The victim's family are convinced it was the work of a ghost said to haunt the plantation, but Humphrey is determined to find a more rational explanation. Meanwhile, Fidel has moved on, leaving Officer Dwayne Myers holding the fort - and while he is struggling to cope, the last thing he needs is the Commissioner stepping in to help. Crime drama, with guest appearances from Holby City's Don Gilet and former Corrie bad girl Natalie Gumede.

programme.title: Harrow
programme.desc: While Grace autopsies the body of an elderly man discovered in an Egyptian sarcophagus, Harrow finds himself trapped in a battle for his own life at the hands of Chester. Australian drama, starring Ioan Gruffudd and Jolene Anderson.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: The leader of a ship workers' union is shot dead in the middle of a labour dispute and his boss sustains gunshot wounds. Burke and Reid initially believe they may have a corporate killing on their hands, but the case remains far from clear until alarming evidence is uncovered that brings everything into sharp focus. Detective drama, guest starring Gordon Kennedy and Joanna Roth.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The squad reopens the investigation into an actress's disappearance when clips of her being assaulted in a 1990 movie are posted on the internet. Director Don Maddox features in the footage, but when questioned, he appears to have problems distinguishing fact from fiction. A potential witness is then found dead, and Brian and Jack are seconded to the unit handling the case, only to find Emily Driscoll (Dennis Waterman's daughter Hannah) is heading the operation. Imogen Stubbs and Sandra Dickinson also guest star.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The squad reinvestigates the death of a timeshare magnate, previously thought to have committed suicide, when a reformed call girl claims she was with him the night he died and saw someone force their way into his house as she left. It then emerges the deceased's widow has since fallen on hard times after being swindled by her late husband's business partner - who is connected to a notorious criminal. Guest starring Shane Richie, Naomi Bentley and Claire Rushbrook.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: Ash Park prepares for a visit from the Prime Minister and his wife in support of George's election campaign, and James begins to learn how to relax in public with Harry.

programme.title: Teleshopping

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Butcher celebrates his forthcoming wedding to Stacey with a riotous stag party in France, but finds Continental hospitality losing its allure after a transport strike strands him on the wrong side of the Channel. While Steve Evans pulls out all the stops to get his friend to the church on time, Dr Sarah Eastwood faces an agonising romantic dilemma and Chris comes to a momentous decision.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Lieutenant Colonel Philip Drysdale, the new CO, arrives with his traditional views on army life and is unimpressed the attitude of B Company's men.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: When Justice Isn't Enough - Part Three
programme.desc: Part three of three. Suspected gay serial killers John Lord and Michael Keenan are brought in for questioning. In spite of the stack of circumstantial evidence against them, a confession looks a long way off as the detectives get deeply embroiled in a battle of wits. Phil Hunter is stunned when wife Cindy breaks down in his arms with news about her IVF treatment.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Sam confronts Chrissie over her distant behaviour towards him, while Faye Morton hopes for help from Jac and Joseph in her bid to secure a nurse's position at the hospital. Elliot is angry when Joseph tells a patient with an inoperable condition that they can help her, but realises a new approach to the illness could hold the answer. Medical drama, starring Patsy Kensit and Tom Chambers.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Holly bravely returns to work, determined to carry on as normal, but her resolve soon cracks as the police start asking questions around A&E, prompting her to retreat back to the safety of her flat. Meanwhile, Charlie keeps a watchful eye on the cocky new receptionist, and Josh finally plucks up the courage to ask Colette for a date. Sandra Huggett and Ian Kelsey star.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: The Sun Hill relief bid a final farewell to murdered colleague Lance Powell and Adam Okaro's funeral address is all the more moving for a spell on the beat alongside Laura Bryant. Nadir and Sim investigate a well known footballer accused of rape and discover he has form - as does the witness who gave his name to the police. A routine drugs bust turns into a free-for-all when the dealer's henchmen turn up in numbers at the critical moment.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Furious about the recent run-in with Jimmy, Grant is ripe for revenge. Ricky discovers that his work brings him closer to home. Mark gives Michelle some brotherly advice.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Grant is eager to get his hands on Jimmy, but Phil has a better plan of revenge. Michelle sits her first exam at college. Pat prepares to take on Mike's insurance company.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Blue Watch are sent on a standby mission, which brings back painful memories for Carole. Meanwhile, the watch trial a new quieter siren.

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Jack suspects a patient of malingering and Beth becomes embroiled in a family dispute when one of her patients suffers a heart attack. Medical drama, starring Kevin Whately and Amanda Burton.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: David and Anna's plans for a romantic weekend away are shattered when their family and friends decide to join them, and Luke has an important question for Megan. Meanwhile, Billy faces up to Sally's death and Zoe crosses swords with feisty local Gaynor, who is intent on cleaning up the canal. Guest starring Celia Imrie.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.sub-title: Wipe That Smile Off Your Tape
programme.desc: Sharon joins a video dating agency and asks Darren to shoot a rehearsal tape, while Garth buys tickets for a Rolling Stones concert.

programme.title: To the Manor Born
programme.desc: Audrey injures her back, but soon recovers when DeVere invites her on a skiing trip. However, when the entrepreneur gives her advance lessons on the estate, he manages to end up the invalid. Comedy, starring Penelope Keith and Peter Bowles.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: The Last Surviving Maurice Chevalier Impression
programme.desc: Compo decides the way to win the heart of Nora Batty is to become a celebrity, so goes on a televised talent show. Gorden Kaye ('Allo 'Allo!) guest stars, alongside Bill Owen, Peter Sallis and Brian Wilde.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Foggy tries to defy his age by entering the annual barrel-rolling competition, and undergoes a gruelling training programme. Meanwhile, Pearl buys Howard a tropical fish tank as a gift. Long-running rural comedy, starring Brian Wilde and Juliette Kaplan.

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The detectives are called out to a robbery where a security guard is found dead. As they try to determine whether his demise was an accident or murder, they expose a complex web of deception among his friends - or enemies. Meanwhile, Lateef uncovers evidence of an international exchange racket. Art Malik guest stars.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: UCOS looks into the murder of a private investigator who was stabbed through the heart in a suspected robbery gone wrong. The answers may lie with the victim's last three cases, but it'll take the whole team's expertise to crack the codes within his mysterious notebook. The movements of a rare stamp could hold the key to the investigation - if only UCOS could track it down. Meanwhile, Steve has problems when he rents out his flat.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The team takes on three cases at once in-between major murder investigations. Harry deals with a hit-and-run on a council estate, Leo investigates the cause of a fire that left a woman dead, and Nikki is called out when a bride-to-be collapses and dies on her hen night. Starring Tom Ward, William Gaminara and Emilia Fox.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: Sequel to The White Queen, set in the Middle Ages and picking up as the tumultuous War of the Roses comes to an end, a new generation ascends to the throne in a tale of power, political clashes, family, love and betrayal. As the victor of the Battle of Bosworth, Henry Tudor, is set to ascend the throne and Elizabeth of York and her family, supporters of the former King, find themselves in grave danger. Lizzie must fulfil her promise to marry King Henry VII and bring peace to the nation. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy, Suki Waterhouse and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: King Henry VII sets out to establish himself as the new sovereign, but finds a dangerous, deeply divided kingdom. Lizzie's loyalties are further complicated by the child she is expecting. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy, Suki Waterhouse and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The arrival of strict new sergeant-major Alan Fitzpatrick causes quite a stir among the ranks, while memories of traumatic episode from Hobbs' past come flooding back during an exercise, threatening his chances of promotion. The boys persuade a reluctant Butcher to invest in a greyhound and the wives reveal their competitive side while organising a charity auction.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Personal problems are high on the troops' agenda as Andy Butcher's mother throws his love life into disarray, Angela McCleod's house is broken into and Sergeant-Major Alan Fitzpatrick learns he cannot treat his daughter like a private on parade.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: The Sun Hill relief bid a final farewell to murdered colleague Lance Powell and Adam Okaro's funeral address is all the more moving for a spell on the beat alongside Laura Bryant. Nadir and Sim investigate a well known footballer accused of rape and discover he has form - as does the witness who gave his name to the police. A routine drugs bust turns into a free-for-all when the dealer's henchmen turn up in numbers at the critical moment.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Donna hands in her notice, but insists that the lottery win has not changed her. Sam tells Jade everything will work out, oblivious to the gossip going around the hospital. Meanwhile, Matt ignores Dean's advice and goes out for a drink with Nikki after the pair meet when he treats her sick father.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Patrick has little time for celebration when Duffy takes her maternity leave, especially once a retired doctor arrives at the hospital and starts putting him through his paces. Medical drama, guest starring Frank Thornton, with Ian Kelsey and Cathy Shipton.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: New boy PC Will Fletcher (Gary Lucy) gets off to a bad start at Sun Hill as he's stopped for speeding on the way, reprimanded for being late and put in his place for an inappropriate remark about a member of the public. He starts to feel more at home after a successful operation and a wind-up by Smithy and Tony Stamp. Things start to turn sour for Terry Perkins when he visits his brother in prison.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: After another exam Michelle finds unexpected help in getting to Pete's inquest, whilst Kathy leaves Natalie and Bianca in charge of the cafe - with chaotic results.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Phil decides it's time to sort Jimmy out. Alan wants to take more responsibility for his grandmother, but Carol isn't too happy about it.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: A huge blaze in a bus depot gives Blue Watch one of their toughest challenges. Carole gets some good news about her future.

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Alice appears in court for non-payment of council tax, a teenager asks Jack for tranquilisers, and interviews are held for the post of fund manager. Medical drama, starring Kevin Whately.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Jack Clayton (ex-Emmerdale actor Ian Kelsey) and his family visit Skelthwaite, the home town of his wife Nisha (former Coronation Street actress Shobna Gulati), who happens to be a nurse - handy for Anna, who is struggling to replace Kim. David doesn't feel like celebrating his birthday as the factory's problems reach crisis point, and Zoe becomes suspicious of a patient's boyfriend.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: The girls' aunt is taken to hospital with a broken leg, and it's up to them to decide whether she goes to an old people's home or comes to stay at their house. Comedy, starring Linda Robson and Pauline Quirke.

programme.title: To the Manor Born
programme.desc: Audrey relishes her role as country commissioner for the Girl Guides when she reprimands Richard for not sponsoring a fundraising event in aid of a new scout hut. Comedy, starring Penelope Keith and Peter Bowles.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: The wily trio set about trying to find a new home for Smiler, whose wife has left him after 33 years of marriage and gone to live with her sister in Australia.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Compo is very upset to learn that that Nora Batty has taken Smiler as a lodger, so Foggy attempts to distract him from his depression by indulging in a spot of dancing. Brian Wilde and Bill Owen star.

programme.title: Judge John Deed
programme.desc: A black man is murdered in a jail cell by a confirmed racist - a crime the prison service blames on overcrowding. However, the judge's probing reveals the institution wasn't operating at full capacity. A drink-driving appeal puts the bench at loggerheads, and Jo distances herself from her former lover. With Donald Sinden and Jenny Seagrove.

programme.title: Judge John Deed
programme.desc: Charlie is appointed to defend an animal rights activist accused of murdering an eminent scientist - a case that will be heard before her father. The defence barrister's support for her client's cause leads her to make a series of unprofessional outbursts in court, while Jo's relationship with Marc Thompson creates tension.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: A skeleton uncovered in the foundations of a swimming pool is identified as a young lottery winner named Cheryl, who was reported missing 17 years ago. The prime suspects are her fellow quiz team-mates, who won their lucky windfall as part of a syndicate, and while some have put their money to good use, the victim's boyfriend has fallen on hard times and the media remain convinced he is the key to her murder. As allegations of affairs, fights and betrayal begin to surface, the team is left to ponder whether money really is the root of all evil.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Harry's burgeoning relationship with Nikki is jeopardised when his former girlfriend Penny is killed in a car crash. It looks like suicide at first glance, but DCI Ambrose uncovers evidence that the victim may have had an affair - as well as a secret child. Meanwhile, Leo examines the staged death of a conceptual artist.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: Elizabeth struggles through her labour, while King Henry's envoys embark on a diplomatic mission to Burgundy, a York stronghold abroad. Negotiations are jeopardised by a twist of fate, and Lizzie learns she has more in common with her husband than she first imagined. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: The York princesses are strategically married off to strengthen the Tudor cause, but further political challenges are on the horizon. When King Henry finds himself back on the battlefield to protect his reign, Lizzie learns that the threats they face may be closer to home. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy, Suki Waterhouse and Michelle Fairley star.

Joe is convinced the case is a poaching war gone wrong, but for Vera, the truth is never that straightforward. Delving into the victim's story, she unearths a sad childhood in the country and a troubled life in the city, scraping by as a novelist. Following the recent death of his grandfather, he returned to Northumberland after a 15-year absence to sell his inheritance to a wealthy couple - but pulled out of the deal at the last minute. Could his death be linked to a dispute over land? Brenda Blethyn and David Leon star in the murder mystery.
